value0.value0: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle
value0.value1: Under no circumstances

value2.value: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle
If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left
Under no circumstances

value0.value0: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is
value0.value1: 15 mph

value2.value: 15 mph
20 mph
25 mph

value0.value0: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street
value0.value1: Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb

value2.value: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street
Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb
One of your rear wheels must touch the curb

value0.value0: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving
value0.value1: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway

value2.value: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway
The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway

value0.value0: When driving in fog, you should use your
value0.value1: Low beams

value2.value: Fog lights only
High beams
Low beams

value0.value0: A white painted curb means
value0.value1: Loading zone for passengers or mail only

value2.value: Loading zone for freight or passengers
Loading zone for passengers or mail only
Loading zone for freight only

value0.value0: A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You should
value0.value1: Stop as long as the red lights are flashing

value2.value: Stop, then proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus
Slow to 25 MPH and pass cautiously
Stop as long as the red lights are flashing

value0.value0: California's "Basic Speed Law" says
value0.value1: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions

value2.value: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits
You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways

value0.value0: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ___ days
To avoid last minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about __________
value0.value1: 10 to 15 seconds

value2.value: 5 to 10 seconds
10 to 15 seconds
15 to 20 seconds

value0.value0: You are about to make a left turn. You must signal continously during the last ____ feet before the turn
Which of the following statements about blind spots is true
value0.value1: Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles

value2.value: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle
Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles
Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rear view mirrors

value0.value0: You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must
value0.value1: Both of the above

value2.value: Leave a note on the vehicle
Report the accident without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the CHP
Both of the above

value0.value0: Unless otherwise posted the speed limit in a residential area is ____
value0.value1: 25 mph

value2.value: 20 mph
25 mph
30 mph

value0.value0: You may legally block an intersection
value0.value1: Under no circumstances

value2.value: When you entered the intersection on the green light
During rush hour traffic
Under no circumstances

value0.value0: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be
value0.value1: Turned to the right (away from the street)

value2.value: Turned to the left (toward the street)
Turned to the right (away from the street)
Parallel with the pavement

value0.value0: With a Class C drivers license a person may drive
value0.value1: A 3-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds

value2.value: A 3-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds
Any 3-axle vehicle regardless of the weight
A vehicle pulling two trailers

value0.value0: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from
value0.value1: The lane closest to the left curb

value2.value: Any lane (as long as it its safe)
The lane closest to the left curb
THe lane in the center of the road

value0.value0: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report (SR1) to the DMV
value0.value1: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries

value2.value: Only if you or the other driver is injured
If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries
Only if you are at fault

value0.value0: Roadways are the most slippery
value0.value1: The first rain after a dry spell

value2.value: During a heavy downpour
After it has been raining for awhile
The first rain after a dry spell

value0.value0: You may not park your vehicle
value0.value1: Withiin 100 feet of an n 100 feet of an elementary school

value2.value: On the side of the freeway in an emergency
Next to a red painted curb
Within 100 feet of an elementary school

value0.value0: You must notify the DMV within 5 days if you
value0.value1: Sell or transfer your vehicle

value2.value: Sell or transfer your vehicle
Fail a smog test for your vehicle
Get a new prescription for lenses or contacts

value0.value0: Two sets of solid, double, yellow lines that are two or more feet apart
value0.value1: May not be crossed for any reason

value2.value: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway
May not be crossed for any reason
Should be treated as a separate traffic lane

value0.value0: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and
value0.value1: Signal for 100 feet before turning

value2.value: Move toward the left side of your lane
Avoid driving in the bicycle lane
Signal for 100 feet before turning

value0.value0: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 MPH. The traffic is traveling at 70 MPH. You may legally drive
value0.value1: No faster than 65 mph

value2.value: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph

value0.value0: It is illegal to park your vehicle
value0.value1: In an unmarked crosswalk

value2.value: In an unmarked crosswalk
Within three feet of a private driveway
In a bicycle lane

value0.value0: The safest precaution that you can take regarding the use of cellular phones and driving is
value0.value1: Use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel

value2.value: Use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel
Keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road
Review the number before answering the call

value0.value0: If you have a green light, but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should
value0.value1: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears

value2.value: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears
Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears
Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic

value0.value0: You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should
value0.value1: Slow down or stop if necessary, and then make the turn

value2.value: Signal and turn immediately
Stop before entering the right lane and let all other traffic go first
Slow down or stop if necessary, and then make the turn

value0.value0: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards
value0.value1: At all times

value2.value: At all times
Only during school hours
Unless you do not see any children present

value0.value0: It is a very windy day. You are driving and a dust storm blows across the freeway reducing your visibility. You should drive slower and turn on your
value0.value1: Headlights

value2.value: Interior lights
Parking lights
Headlights

value0.value0: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should
value0.value1: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane

value2.value: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane
Assume the other drive will let you pass if you use your turn signal
Assume the other drive will maintain a constant speed

value0.value0: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 mph. Most of the other vehicles are driving 70 mph or faster. You may legally drive
value0.value1: No faster than 65 mph

value2.value: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph

value0.value0: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction and continually pass the other cars, you will
value0.value1: Increase your changes of an accident

value2.value: Get you to your destination much faster and safer
Increase your changes of an accident
Help prevent traffic congestion

value0.value0: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks
value0.value1: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards

value2.value: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards
Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer
Any vehicle with 3 or more axles or weighing more than 4,000 pounds

value0.value0: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if
value0.value1: Traffic on the street moves to the left

value2.value: A sign permits the turn
Traffic on the street moves to the right
Traffic on the street moves to the left

value0.value0: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck
value0.value1: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn

value2.value: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes
May have to swing wide to complete the right turn
Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning

value0.value0: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle, if the yellow line next to
value0.value1: Your side of the road is a broken line

value2.value: The other side of the road is a solid line
Your side of the road is a broken line
The other side of the road is a broken line

value0.value0: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always
value0.value1: Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming

value2.value: Stop, listen, and proceed cautiously
Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming
Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason

value0.value0: You drive defensively when you
value0.value1: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards

value2.value: Always put one car length between you and the car ahead
Look only at the car in front of you while driving
Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards

value0.value0: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive
value0.value1: Farther behind the truck than you would for a passenger vehicle

value2.value: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead
Farther behind the truck than you would for a passenger vehicle
No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you

value0.value0: All of the following practices are dangerous to do while driving. Which of these is also illegal
value0.value1: Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears

value2.value: Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears
Adjusting your outside mirrors
Transporting an unrestrained animal inside the vehicle

value0.value0: Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when
value0.value1: You don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks

value2.value: You don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks
The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic
You transport two or more young children in a passenger vehicle

value0.value0: When you tailgate other drivers (drive close to their rear bumper)
value0.value1: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry

value2.value: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry
Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation
You help reduce traffic congestion

value0.value0: Should you always drive slower than other traffic
value0.value1: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly

value2.value: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly
Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique
Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic

value0.value0: You see a signal persion at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions
value0.value1: At all times

value2.value: Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead
Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws
At all times

value0.value0: When can you drive in a bicycle lane
value0.value1: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right

value2.value: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane
When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right
When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right

value0.value0: You see a flashing yellow traffic signal at an upcoming intersection. The flashing yellow light means
value0.value1: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully

value2.value: Stop before entering the intersection as long as you can do so safely
Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully

value0.value0: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrain crossing your lane ahead. You should
value0.value1: Stop and let him/her finish crossing the street

value2.value: Make eye contact and then pass him/her
Slow down as you pass him/her
Stop and let him/her finish crossing the street

value0.value0: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles
value0.value1: Next to the solid line may pass

value2.value: In both directions may pass
Next to the broken line may pass
Next to the solid line may pass
